title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Albuquerque

content.rendered:
Albuquerque, a.k.a ABQ is the largest and most populous city of New Mexico in the United States. And if you’re a fan of Mister White and Jesse Pinkman, like just about everyone else on the planet, you don’t need an introduction to Albuquerque. You know its desert terrain and sepia skies all too well. Named after the Duke of Alburquerque (Yes, they dropped the ‘r’ but it’s still a big debate,) the Duke City and its wonders await you! So let’s get to know all about rooms for rent in Albuquerque and what the average rent in Albuquerque looks like, along with all sorts of fun stuff you should know about visiting!

Related: 15 Best Things to do in Albuquerque

Getting to know Albuquerque

While the Breaking Bad characters were interested in the deserts for their own reasons, Albuquerque, being located in central New Mexico, has semi-desert terrain, mountains forested with juniper and pine, and eco regions, depending on where you’re located.

Back in around the 8th Century, what is now called Albuquerque, already had multi storey stone buildings called pueblos, and if you’re a history buff, there’s lots of history to keep you busy here! But the area keeps up with the modern day, too. The first U.S. Bitcoin vending machine was installed in an Albuquerque cigar shop.

Surrounded by Sandia mountains in the east and an extinct volcano on the west, nature surrounds the Duke city as much as its culture does. Now let’s get straight to what you should know about rooms for rent in Albuquerque and average rent in Albuquerque.

Finding rooms for rent in Albuquerque

The city is geographically divided into 4 quadrants, namely, North East (NE), North West (NW), South East (SE) & South West (SW).

Find Rooms For Rent in Albuquerque

Top neighborhoods in Albuquerque

  • Nob Hill: A vibrant neighborhood adorned with neon signs, great dining spaces and happening nightspots with its route 66 architecture, Nob hill will always delight you when you’re looking for rooms for rent in Albuquerque.
  • Old Town: Established in the 1700s, this one’s Albuquerque’s first neighborhood. And it still is its cultural center, with architecture, shopping, art and cuisine to enjoy while you look for cheap rooms for rent.
  • Balloon Fiesta: Just as fun as it sounds, this neighborhood is home to the balloon fiesta park and museum. And with its dining and lodging options, it’s a great and colorful neighborhood to explore when looking for rooms for rent in Albuquerque.

Average rent in Albuquerque

University life in Albuquerque

With 18 libraries in the Albuquerque and Bernalillo County Library System serving the city. There are plenty of books to self educate when you live here.

Top Universities in Albuquerque

  • The University of New Mexico
  • Brookline College
  • Carrington College
  • Southwestern Indian Polytechnic Institute
  • Central New Mexico Community College

How transit friendly is Albuquerque?

1. Walkability in Albuquerque

Albuquerque is the 28th most walkable city of the 50 largest cities, as per WalkScore, in terms of commuting. Moreover, it has walkable zones where you can enjoy a quiet stroll that leads to nowhere.

2. Cycling in Albuquerque

Albuquerque has trails, bike routes and dedicated paths throughout. With its first Bicycle Boulevard up and running in 2009, there are plans for more investment in biking infrastructure and convenience in the future.

3. Public transportation in Albuquerque

The Alvarado Transportation Center hosts the city bus system, ABQ RIDE which includes the rapid ride express bus services for inter city travel. Amtrak’s railways serve Albuquerque too with daily commuter rail services.

4. Airports in Albuquerque

2 airports serve the city: Albuquerque International Sunport and Double Eagle II Airport. While the former serves civilians, the latter is primarily used as an air ambulance, corporate flight, military flight, training flight, charter flight, and private flight facility.

Cultural activities in Albuquerque

Albuquerque International Balloon Fiesta

If you’re looking for rooms for rent in Albuquerque in October, you’ll see the New Mexico skies filled with colorful balloons for 9 days as part of the International Balloon Fiesta! Want to join in the fun? You can hop on a hot air balloon of your choice and fly away into the beautiful skies overlooking the scenic landscape!

Sandia Peak Tramway

The Sandia Peak gets its name from Sandia that means ‘watermelons’ in Spanish, because the mountains resemble watermelons at dusk. Sounds super cute, doesn’t it? You can hike to the summit, or enjoy an aerial view of the peaks via the tramway. Either way, it’s a great way to see Albuquerque!

Casa Rondena Winery

Looking for cheap rooms for rent in Albuquerque, – like anywhere else – can get tiresome. So when you’re looking for some time out, head to the Casa Rondena Winery and delve into the music, culture, architecture, and of course, sample some wine from the area!

Historical spots in Albuquerque

Albuquerque Museum of Art and History

A city that boasts a history like no other, the Albuquerque Museum of Art and History preserves all that’s ancient about the city. Visit the museum to see displays of old Spanish settlement’s ways of living, to Georgia O’Keefe’s art, all in one place!

Indian Pueblo Cultural Center

If you’re interested in the Pueblo cultures of the New Mexico area, then this is one place you must visit. From an outstanding museum, tours and traditional dances, to lip smacking new native American cuisine, you’re bound to experience history with all your senses. And you’ll spot the multi storey stone buildings (pueblos) that we mentioned before too!

Petroglyph National Monument

Interested in primitive art? This outdoor museum is for you! The Petroglyph National Monument protects one of the largest petroglyph sites in North America, featuring designs and symbols carved onto volcanic rocks by Native Americans and Spanish settlers 400 to 700 years ago!

So there you have it! This is pretty much all you need to know when looking for rooms for rent in Albuquerque.

We’ve got your back!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Albuquerque? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
